verses.kjv: Children, obey your parents in the Lord: for this is right.
verses.ct: Children, do what your parents tell you, as the Lord wants — this is the right thing to do.

verses.kjv: Honour thy father and mother; which is the first commandment with promise;
verses.ct: "Respect your father and mother" — this is the first commandment that comes with a promise:

verses.kjv: That it may be well with thee, and thou mayest live long on the earth.
verses.ct: so that things will go well for you and you will enjoy a long life on the earth.

verses.kjv: And, ye fathers, provoke not your children to wrath: but bring them up in the nurture and admonition of the Lord.
verses.ct: Fathers, don't push your children to the point of anger. Instead, raise them with the training and guidance that comes from the Lord.

verses.kjv: Servants, be obedient to them that are your masters according to the flesh, with fear and trembling, in singleness of your heart, as unto Christ;
verses.ct: Workers, follow the instructions of your earthly employers with deep respect and sincerity, as if you were serving Christ himself.

verses.kjv: Not with eyeservice, as menpleasers; but as the servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart;
verses.ct: Don't just work hard when someone is watching to impress people. Instead, as servants of Christ, carry out God's will with your whole heart.

verses.kjv: With good will doing service, as to the Lord, and not to men:
verses.ct: Do your work with a positive attitude, as though you're working for the Lord rather than for people.

verses.kjv: Knowing that whatsoever good thing any man doeth, the same shall he receive of the Lord, whether he be bond or free.
verses.ct: Remember that the Lord will reward everyone for whatever good they do, whether they are enslaved or free.

verses.kjv: And, ye masters, do the same things unto them, forbearing threatening: knowing that your Master also is in heaven; neither is there respect of persons with him.
verses.ct: Employers, treat your workers the same way. Stop using threats. Remember that both you and they share the same Master in heaven, and he doesn't play favorites.

verses.kjv: Finally, my brethren, be strong in the Lord, and in the power of his might.
verses.ct: Finally, brothers and sisters, draw your strength from the Lord and from his mighty power.

verses.kjv: Put on the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.
verses.ct: Put on every piece of God's armor so that you can stand firm against the devil's schemes.

verses.kjv: For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places.
verses.ct: Our struggle isn't against human opponents, but against rulers, authorities, cosmic powers of this present darkness, and spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms.

verses.kjv: Wherefore take unto you the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to withstand in the evil day, and having done all, to stand.
verses.ct: That is why you must take up God's full armor, so that when the day of evil comes, you can resist and still be standing after you've done everything possible.

verses.kjv: Stand therefore, having your loins girt about with truth, and having on the breastplate of righteousness;
verses.ct: So stand firm! Strap on truth like a belt around your waist, and put on righteousness as your chest armor.

verses.kjv: And your feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace;
verses.ct: Fit your feet with the readiness that comes from the good news of peace.

verses.kjv: Above all, taking the shield of faith, wherewith ye shall be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked.
verses.ct: Most importantly, pick up the shield of faith, which will enable you to extinguish every flaming arrow the evil one launches at you.

verses.kjv: And take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God:
verses.ct: Put on salvation as your helmet, and take up the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God.

verses.kjv: Praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit, and watching thereunto with all perseverance and supplication for all saints;
verses.ct: Pray at all times through the Spirit, using every kind of prayer and request. Stay alert and never give up as you pray for all of God's people.

verses.kjv: And for me, that utterance may be given unto me, that I may open my mouth boldly, to make known the mystery of the gospel,
verses.ct: Pray for me too — that whenever I speak, the right words will be given to me so I can boldly reveal the mystery of the good news.

verses.kjv: For which I am an ambassador in bonds: that therein I may speak boldly, as I ought to speak.
verses.ct: I serve as an ambassador for this message even while I'm in chains. Pray that I will proclaim it as boldly as I should.

verses.kjv: But that ye also may know my affairs, and how I do, Tychicus, a beloved brother and faithful minister in the Lord, shall make known to you all things:
verses.ct: So that you can know how I'm doing and what's happening with me, Tychicus — a dear brother and faithful servant of the Lord — will fill you in on everything.

verses.kjv: Whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose, that ye might know our affairs, and that he might comfort your hearts.
verses.ct: I'm sending him to you specifically for this reason: so you can learn about our situation and so he can encourage your hearts.

verses.kjv: Peace be to the brethren, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: May peace, love, and faith come to the brothers and sisters from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: Grace be with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity. Amen.
verses.ct: May grace be with everyone who loves our Lord Jesus Christ with an undying love. Amen.
